entry.title: Pashinyan's condolences on plane crash ignored by Baku

media:group.media:title: Pashinyan's condolences on plane crash ignored by Baku
media:group.media:description:
üìç The Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe‚Äôs Minsk Group, set up in 1992 to mediate the Nagorno-Karabakh conflict, should be dissolved, Russia's Foreign Ministry spokesperson Maria Zakharova said. üìç Armenia's Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan expressed his condolences on the crash of an Azerbaijani Airlines plane in Kazakhstan that was flying from Baku to Grozny in Russia's Chechnya region. üìç A Yerevan court has rejected Mayor Tigran Avinyan‚Äôs request to waive the state fee worth roughly $400 for his defamation lawsuit against CivilNet.

entry.title: Armenia‚Äôs high stakes in the year ahead

media:group.media:title: Armenia‚Äôs high stakes in the year ahead
media:group.media:description:
In this Civilnet podcast interview, analyst Eric Hacopian provides a glimpse into Armenia's trajectory in the pivotal year ahead. Hacopian delves deep into the economic, political, military, and foreign policy dynamics that will test the country's resilience, offering a roadmap of opportunities that could define Armenia's path.

entry.title: Aurora panelists discuss global efforts for gender equality

media:group.media:title: Aurora panelists discuss global efforts for gender equality
media:group.media:description:
Partner content
The Human Rights and Humanitarian Forum in May 2024 brought together influential voices to Los Angeles to discuss gender justice and women‚Äôs empowerment. Organized by the Aurora Humanitarian Initiative in collaboration with UCLA‚Äôs The Promise Institute for Human Rights, the event addressed critical challenges and opportunities for advancing gender equity worldwide. Speakers included Ilwad Elman, 2020 Aurora Prize Laureate and Director of Programs at the Elman Peace Center; Zubaida Akbar, Afghanistan Program Manager at FEMENA; Janine di Giovanni, Executive Director of The Reckoning Project; and Zubaida Bai, President and CEO of the Grameen Foundation. Moderated by Aurora Board Member and founder of Memory Matters, Alice Greenwald, the discussion explored how global systems can better serve women and girls.

entry.title: US denies it supplies Armenia with lethal weapons

media:group.media:title: US denies it supplies Armenia with lethal weapons
media:group.media:description:
üìç The U.S. State Department has denied claims by Azerbaijani President Ilham Aliyev that Washington supplies Armenia with lethal weapons. üìç Armenian Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan will not participate in the annual unofficial gathering of ex-Soviet states held today in St. Petersburg. üìç Concerns raised about contradictory trends in Yerevan's 2025 budget. üìç A ruined promenade: Ani, between Armenia and Turkey- https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SP1GrTfGlUA
Credits: Ruptly

media:group.media:description:
üìç Armenia‚Äôs former presidents have each rejected a call from Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan to have a live debate with him. üìç Armenia‚Äôs selection process for its next European Court of Human Rights judge continues to face scrutiny, with concerns ranging from dual citizenship restrictions to a lack of transparency in the evaluation procedures. üìç Azerbaijan‚Äôs digital war on France: https://www.civilnet.am/en/news/810445/azerbaijans-digital-war-on-france/ üìç What‚Äôs behind Armenia‚Äôs military reform?‚Äù https://www.civilnet.am/en/news/810410/whats-behind-armenias-military-reform/
